definition: to feel attached to/to long for/to love

sentences.english: Chi Zijian's novel has strong hometown feelings.
sentences.chinese: 迟子建小说有着浓浓的乡恋情结。

sentences.english: Do you believe the "one-night stand" can evolve into love affair?
sentences.chinese: 一夜激情可能发展为恋情吗？

sentences.english: Unhappy marriages or relationships are the result of subjugating oneself to one's spouse or partner.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的婚姻或恋情是一个人屈从于配偶或伴侣的结果。

sentences.english: Romance with someone from another country or different culture is likely.
sentences.chinese: 有可能和别国的人或是其他文化的人发展恋情。

sentences.english: One was with a bow, named Lance.
sentences.chinese: 一段是与一张名叫朗斯的弓的恋情。

sentences.english: Multicolored amour, mental place to, give people the space of infinite freedom.
sentences.chinese: 五彩斑斓的恋情，精神所向，给人们无限自由的空间。

sentences.english: Thai Arabica Coffee is my first lover.
sentences.chinese: 泰国咖啡，我的初恋情人。

sentences.english: The Friends of the son of the Aga with love, whether or not to continue to develop?
sentences.chinese: 而阿嘉跟友子的恋情，是否能够继续发展下去？

sentences.english: Who could Britta have a long-term relationship with?
sentences.chinese: 布瑞塔可能跟谁一起发展长期恋情？

sentences.english: "Besame Mucho" and "Dancing in the Dark" are sultry romances wafted on light Latin beats.
sentences.chinese: “和”黑暗中的舞蹈“拉丁节奏的轻飘荡闷热的恋情。

sentences.english: Brother got married, my sister-in-law is my first love.
sentences.chinese: 哥哥结婚了，嫂子竟然是我得初恋情人。

sentences.english: After all, she was my first lover.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，她是我的初恋情人。

sentences.english: They prefer to be the woman's first love.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢当女人的初恋情人。

sentences.english: What relics from past romances would YOU leave in the Museum of Broken Hearts?
sentences.chinese: 从过去的恋情中，你能在失恋博物馆留下什么纪念品？

sentences.english: And then there's the possibility of romance with someone she meets there.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她偶然和一个遇到的人开始了浪漫的恋情。

sentences.english: The moundsman has a transitory amour.
sentences.chinese: 那个棒球投手和她有段短暂恋情。

definition: emotion/sentiment/affection/feelings between two persons/CL:個|个[ge4],種|种[zhong3]
to fall head over heels in love/to be passionately in love
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
love between an older woman and a younger man
to part company/to split up/to break up
to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
to achieve Buddhahood through one's efforts and insight/to obtain a positive outcome after sustained efforts/to come to fruition
